meanings.definition: A person who pursues a career, especially with opportunism or disregard for ethical considerations.
meanings.sent1: The ambitious careerist quickly climbed the corporate ladder.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a careerist, always focused on advancing her professional status.
meanings.sent3: The careerist decided to skip the team-building retreat to work on a project alone.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle of office politics, the careerist was the lion hunting for success.
meanings.sent5: The careerist's determination to succeed was as bright as a shining star.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a careerist or careerism.
meanings.sent1: Her careerist mindset led her to make decisions solely based on personal gain.
meanings.sent2: The company culture became more competitive due to the careerist approach of the new CEO.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see the usually laid-back team member adopt a careerist attitude.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline changed as the careerist developers built towering skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The impact of her careerist actions reverberated throughout the organization.
